patient_info: Ovarian cyst,Abnormal vagina morphology,Abnormality of the breast,Cafe-au-lait spot,Accelerated skeletal maturation,Premature thelarche,Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia,Monostotic fibrous dysplasia,Pain,Increased serum estradiol,Decreased circulating follicle stimulating hormone concentration,Decreased circulating luteinizing hormone level,Enlarged tonsils,Increased size of nasopharyngeal adenoids,Metrorrhagia,Enlarged uterus
golden_diagnosis: McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic,McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic,McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic
predict_diagnosis:
1. Polyostotic Fibrous Dysplasia - A condition characterized by the abnormal growth of fibrous tissue in multiple bones (osteoclast activation). 
2. Monostotic Fibrous Dysplasia - A condition where abnormal bone growth occurs in a single bone (osteoclast activation). 
3. Precipitated Puberty - An early onset of sexual maturation in females, often caused by a hormonal imbalance or tumor. 
4. Thelarche - Enlargement of the breasts before age 9, often an indicator of ovarian function or tumor activity. 
5. Hypogonadism - A decreased function of the testes or ovaries, leading to infertility and secondary sexual characteristics delay. 
6. Tropical Dwarfism - A condition caused by a specific type of rickets in tropical regions, resulting in skeletal changes and delayed growth. 
7. Growth Hormone Excess - An excess in growth hormone, causing accelerated skeletal maturation and enlarged tonsils. 
8. Estrogen Receptor Beta (ER-B) Mutations - Mutations in the ER-B gene can lead to increased sensitivity to estrogen, resulting in ovarian cysts and enlarged uterus. 
9. Endometriosis - A condition where endometrial tissue is abnormally located in the pelvis, causing pain, abnormal vaginal bleeding, and enlarged uterus. 
10. Gonadotropin-Releasing Hormone (GnRH) Antagonist Use - The use of GnRH antagonists in the treatment of ovarian cysts or uterine fibroids can cause ovarian cysts and accelerated ovarian function.
